TopicTitle: Rocket chart with the center of gravity

Articles.Content:
Hi!

This chart shows the position of the center of gravity and the center of drag on a KSP rocket (Pioneer 1).

Together with the drag (as acceleration) you can pick the point where 'max Q' happens and see the lever between

the center of gravity and the center of drag.

Interesting chart!

So there was an instability phase (CoD in front of CoM) from 90 to 100 seconds? I guess you where too high for it to matter.

How fast and high were you @ maxQ?

So there was an instability phase (CoD in front of CoM) from 90 to 100 seconds?

I think you've got it backwards. It was unstable nearly all the way through the first stage burn duration.

Now what was this chart made with? If it's a mod, I want it.

Ah yes, I read it backwards

How did you keep it pointing up?
I wonder how the atmospheric pressure and speed (drag proportional) play into this. Wouldn't it be that at around 100s the air became thin enough for drag to become non-issue?

Ah yes, I read it backwards

How did you keep it pointing up?

Gimbals/reactive controls.

Actually having a rocket that is slightly imbalanced makes it easier to control as long as it doesn't overshoot away from the prograde vector.

Now what was this chart made with? If it's a mod, I want it.

At the very least, is there a mod that indicates COM, COD, And COL while in game?

Hi !

Thanks for the replies. I will make a new flight and log the data you ask for. It will take a day or so for making all flight charts.

Nice!

It's very similar to what OpenRocket and Rocsim does for model rockets in real life. Same physics, same kind of graph.
Thread moved to the subforum for this sort of nuts-and-bolts info.
Here the new charts. I am not sure if the drag is right; it increases after the speed of 300 m/s (?) I used the FAR mod.
very nice. since you have all of this acceleration versus time data, did you integrate it to find your total delta-v and delta-v losses?
Very cool. Thanks. What do you use to collect data this data in flight?

Very cool. Thanks. What do you use to collect data this data in flight?

I used the KOS mod for logging the data.
